reviews.review_msg: Dr. Shaw is the BEST instructor in the SA department. She is very engaged and organized during her lectures. I found her class to be very relevant to current issues. Each class is exciting as she makes learning fun! Her assignments are graded fairly with clear rubrics to follow. Her use of Canvas is well organized and she posts ALL lectures.

Dr. Shaw is one of the best instructors I have had during my post-secondary education. Lectures are very engaging and tests are based off the slides. Written assignments are clearly explained and she provides lots of details in her feedback. I recommend using her office hours and participating in class. She's very welcoming and easy to talk to!

Dr. Shaw is amazing! You can just tell that she is so passionate about her work and Sociology and Anthropology in general. She really cares about each students' success and makes sure all assignment outlines are fully equipped with full expectations. On top of that, Dr. Shaw is hilarious and makes coming to class not feel like a chore :-)

Jenny is truly a wonderful professor. She is extremely engaging and passionate, which made coming to class exciting. The readings and material were refreshing and interesting, definitely relatable to the course. Jenny has been one one my favourite professors at SFU and reminds me why I chose Sociology in the first place.

Jenny is such a great instructor! She is so engaging and passionate about the subject that she teaches. The readings assigned may be much but are always valuable and relevant to the subject. She is such a genuine and intelligent person making her classes that much more amazing! Highly recommend taking her classes!

Jenny is a wonderful professor. If you ask for assistance, she is very eager to help you and see you succeed. She gives clear expectations and feedback. The way this course is taught however requires a lot of participation, sharing, and in-class games/activities. If this isn't your learning style, you will find it difficult and maybe even draining.

Jenny is an amazing professor that cares about the material and the students. The lectures are relevant and easy to follow. The readings are easy to do and not too onerous. She is an incredibly fair marker, gives insightful feedback, and is fast to return your work. Honestly couldn't ask for a better prof, you definitely need to take her class!

Jenny is great! She is passionate about anthropology and strives to stay engaged with her students. I would highly recommend taking a class with her, especially if you are new to anthropology! She's a fair marker and makes her expectations very clear and she's always available and happy to help students if needed. Participation is vert important.

Jenny is an angel. She has great lectures (which she provides online), thought-provoking discussion questions, 30 minute weekly presentations, and everything had a clear grading criteria. Jenny clearly cares about her field, and she her passion shows through every time she speaks. She also bought us breakfast on the last day of class.
